content.title: Financial Assistance For Marriage (APB&OCWWB)
content.details: The scheme 'Financial Assistance for Marriage' was started by the Department of Labour and Employment, Govt. of Arunachal Pradesh for registered workers of Arunachal Pradesh Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (APB&OCWWB). The state government has proposed and implemented this scheme through the APB&OCWWB for providing financial assistance for marriage of two children of the registered workers.
benefits: Under this scheme, the cash assistance of ₹10,000/- will be given to the registered workers.
eligibility: The applicant should be a permanent resident of Arunachal Pradesh.
The applicant must be employed in the Building and Other Construction works.
The applicant should be registered with Labour Welfare Board (APB&OCWWB).
The applicant’s membership must be active at the time of application for availing marriage assistance of his/her children.
The age of applicant’s children should be above 18 and 21 years of age for female and male respectively.
documents_required: Identity proof i.e. Aadhaar Card, Voter ID card etc.
Xerox copy of the registration card of the worker
Bank Account number/ front page of the passbook
Birth certificate as age proof of children

faqs.question: What is the objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The objective of this scheme is to provide financial assistance for the marriage of two children of registered workers.

faqs.question: By which department was this scheme launched?
faqs.answer: Department of Labour and Employment, Government of Arunachal Pradesh.

faqs.question: What is the full form of APB&OCWWB?
faqs.answer: Arunachal Pradesh Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board.

faqs.question: How much cash assistance will be given to the eligible worker?
faqs.answer: Cash assistance of ₹10,000/- will be given to the registered workers for the marriage of his/her children.

faqs.question: For how many children will the financial assistance be given to the registered worker?
faqs.answer: The financial assistance will be provided only for the marriage of two children of the registered workers.

faqs.question: Who is eligible under this scheme?
faqs.answer: The registered worker under Board is eligible to avail of marriage assistance for his/her children under the scheme.

faqs.question: Is this scheme only for a worker /labour of Arunachal Pradesh?
faqs.answer: Yes, the applicant should be a permanent resident of Arunachal Pradesh.

faqs.question: Is it mandatory to be registered under Board?
faqs.answer: Yes, the labour/worker must be a registered worker under the Board.

faqs.question: Can a worker also eligible to take the benefits of the scheme if membership has been expired?
faqs.answer: No, the worker’s membership shall be active to take the benefits of the scheme.

faqs.question: How can I avail the benefits of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The applicant needs to contact Registering Officers, APB&OCWWB of the respective District.

faqs.question: Can I get the application form online for registration?
faqs.answer: Yes, the registration form can be downloaded from the official website of the Labour Welfare Board, Department of Labour and Employment.
